results.title: Socialisation: the Dragon School, Oxford (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Argent, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality and Learning”.
Looks at the process of socialisation in the Dragon school, an Oxford preparatory school of some 600 pupils, mostly boys, but with 24 girls. Illustrates some of the values of the school, different teaching approaches and the attitude explicit and implicit to social control.

results.title: Social sex attitudes in adolescence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
A document on the lives of fictitious Bob and Mary, focusing on the teen years. Here, lovestruck Mary is in her “hangout” stage when she always has a need to be “more sophisticated than she actually is.” Cross to Bob where his mother discovers a crude naughty drawing in his room and narrator Lorne Greene croons: “It became apparent that his interest in girls was getting to be more than casual.” But happily, Mary has maintained her virginal purity: “They knew that this time it was for keeps.” says Greene as the two gaze at a window display of refrigerators. But the couple refuse to succumb to temptation until they’re married.

results.title: Social psychology
results.creator_credit: Leslie Hill and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 24 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Human beings are social animals. We live in groups and are influenced by others. Social psychology is interested in how people affect each other, in the individual in the context of the group. In particular the program looks at how stereotyping allows us to make immediate, albeit rough, assumptions about how a person may behave so that we may react appropriately. However the same process of stereotyping can lead to prejudice and bias which may in turn lead to small or large scale conflict.

results.title: Social enquiry: questions, answers and action
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and Bob Scarfe
results.brief_description: Looks at two classes, one at year 4 and one at year 10, engaged in effective enquiry learning. Both are investigating local issues involving the environment, plus the decision making processes that enable change to take place. Different stages of the enquiry sequence are featured which allow observations to be made about teaching strategies and the learning processes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and Bob Scarfe

results.title: Social encounter
results.brief_description: Seven separate one-minute “telespots” depicting various types of social relationships: Loveliness of a woman; Walk like a man; Masks of man; The smile; Driver and pedestrian; I hate elevators; Restricted neighbourhood. The “spots” are designed to facilitate discussion on the impact of personal values on various every-day situations. Thought provoking.

results.title: Social development
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Neil Howe
results.brief_description: Australia has accepted the responsibility of training and assisting the people of Papua and New Guinea who are on the threshold of a more complex way of life. Education at the primary level for some is being established. Health services include the provision of hospitals and doctors and the training of young men and women to teach sanitation and hygiene. Religious teaching is undertaken by Missions, and European sports and pastimes are taking the place of tribal feasts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maslyn Williams, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Neil Howe

results.title: Social development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
An analysis of social behaviour at different age levels and the reasons underlying the changes in behaviour patterns as the child develops. Stresses the point that while the child must meet and solve each problem as they reach that level of growth, guidance from understanding parents can make the adjustment easier and smoother.
